reviews.review:
This game... This game is something else. Some people say it's "too bloody". Me? I say those people are weak.
In all seriousness though, this game blew me away. I have played it for just over an hour so far, and it's incredible! I got it on sale for $10.00, but frankly, having played it, I would have payed the full $40.00

--------------------------------------------------------------over all---------------------------------------------------------------
GET. THIS. GAME!
Amazing game. This is one of a few handful of games that had me completely immersed in the world. Better than Bioshock, in my opinion.
This game is a work of art, a real masterpiece! Magnificent environments, solid characters and intense combat.

This game is amazing. The story is great, the graphics and enviornment is great, the difficulty level is spot on, and the abilities are interesting. If you haven't played this yet, you need to. There's really nothing else to say about it besides it's amazing.
Great game. The story and gameplay is excellent, as i have come to expect from a bioshock game.
Oh my, so Beautiful!

Easily makes my top 10 games list.  Best in the Bioshock series.  Ken Levine and co has done it again.  I wish I could go back in time, forget about the story, and relive my experiences playing this game over and over and over again.

A horribly easy game with a bit of a boring story and a pretentious mood.

I beat it in normal mode in 6.5 hours and, yes, I looked around for everything and found all the secrets... which really aren't secrets as they are in your face and not hidden AT ALL.

An annoying girl keep giving you free ammo, weapons and money the entire game, making it hard for you to lose.

Bioshock 1 was an amazing game. This is not.

4/10
it`s a perfect game
best. ever.
this game i fucking awesome
While it does not share the same intense gameplay of its original predecessor, it's worth playing alone for the visual experience.

Nice graphics and voice acting, but it didn't really grab me with the atmosphere like the original bioshock and certainly didn't immerse me quite as much as System Shock 2. The ending really annoyed me too, a bit cheap and predictable.
GODDAMNIT I COULDVE SAVED 10 DOLLARS IF I HAD WAITED JUST ONE MORE DAY, WHY DOES THIS ALWAYS HAPPEN TO ME.

Hammer Grafik, extrem gute Story, solides Gameplay (vor allem mit Controller). Zwar nicht mehr umterm Meer aber trotzdem ein geiler Bioshock Teil! Leider ist die Kampagne locker in 12 Stunden durchgespielt, aber dafür gibt es zum Glück schon einige DLCs.

A fantastic game with a great story. I won't pretend that you won't have an idea of the ending reveals because you can think it out pretty well. I enjoyed the heck out of this game and this is from someone who hasn't played the first and second. I think it did a pretty nice job of tying its ideas and focuses up, but there isn't much I can say without spoiling things. This is EASILY a $60.00 value in my humble opinion. A steal for any less.

Great artistical experience but with incredibly boring gunplay. 
If you are into shooters - avoid. 
If you want to admire the scenery/Elizabeth - buy without thinking :)
Bockt!
Super Game, geniale Grafik und extrem gute Story

this game is probably one of the best fps games i have played since borderlands 2, the amount of story within it made me felt i was apart of it and everytime an important story sequence happened good or bad i always wondered what would happen next. No multiplayer but i dont think it was realy needed because of the time taken away from multiplayer they could focus more on the story which is what a lot of games lack these days. i would gladly reccommend this to a friend, if you are really involved with  fps games than definitely check this one out, i guarentee it will be worth every penny :)
This is an amazing game everything about it is amazing especially the story, the way the game ends is outstanding
Perfect!
Buy this game!
Super Spiel, tolle Atmosphäre, super Grafik und läuft auch auf einer GTX650 in sehr hoch mit im Schnitt 25-30 FPS. Für 7,49€ unbedingt zuschlagen!

Allgemein:
Eines vorweg, ich habe vor Bioshock infinite kein Bioshock gespielt, ich habe mir aber wegen diesem Spiel die anderen Teile auch noch zugelegt.
Bioshock Infinite habe ich damals wegen irgendeinem Sale gekauft, ich hatte viel von diesem Spiel gehört, könnte aber nie ein grösseres Interesse dafür aufbringen.

Zum Spiel:
Ich bin vom Spiel restlos begeistert.
Für die Geschichte habe ich rund 11 Stunden benötigt (Schwierigkeit: Schwer). In diesen 11 Stunden wurde ich auf sehr hohem Niveau unterhalten, aber nicht wie sonst mit einer Call of Battlefield-Unterhaltung, sondern mit einer Geschichte, die mich tief in die Welt von Bioshock Infinite hineingezogen hat. Eine Geschichte mit coolen Charakteren und vielen Wendungen. 
Das Ende möchte ich speziell hervorheben, ich habe lange nicht so ein durchdachtes Ende in einem Spiel gesehen. 
Leider ist das Gameplay nicht so motivierend wie die Geschichte, das ist aber der einzige negative Punkt der mir aufgefallen ist.
Die Spielwelt ist packend und transportiert die Atmosphäre der Geschichte vorbildlich.

Ich empfehle das Spiel jedem weiter der gerne eine spannende Geschichte, auf dem Niveau von Mass Effect, in spielen erleben möchte.
Awesome story, graphics, gameplay. A must to have played
<3 <3 <3 MUST PLAY <3 <3 <3
this is a exellent game, trust me.
Superb! Cant stop playing!
This is the BEST Bioshock out to date by far.
This is a BEAUTIFUL, engaging, fun, exhilirating, and outright AMAZING video game. I HIGHLY reccomend Bioshock Infinite along with the first Bioshock to all who can run it.
This game is amazing, great story and gameplay: 10/10

Excellent story, though gameplay(shooting and actions) not perfect, but the game is deep in politics, it makes you think about many things as you play the game. It is a must-play game for me.

Bioshock infinte is a game that strives for perfection and at the end achives it in spades with no harm from the games powerfull and unforgeterble ending and the strong fluid and fun gamplay.

Bioshock Infinite is not a game about Christian fundamentalism or race relations or political extremism or expansionist wars. There’s a little bit of all of those things but not enough to be meaningful or interesting. It’s rather belittling to the seriousness of the topics that are invoked that nothing is ever done with them. I endured the entirety of this game not caring about anything that happened.

Separate Bioshock Infinite from Ken Levine and Bioshock, and technically it is a fine game. Everything functions properly. Voice acting is OK. Little details in zones means there’s something cute around every corner. But these sorts of things don’t make a game a masterpiece. It just means the devs had the time and money.

On top of the muddled storytelling is the rather lackluster ending that gives the impression Levine simply tried to dress up what was already a terrible, half-assed idea with pretentious intellectualism.

I wish I had played the game everyone else seems to be raving about.

Ich kann es kaum fassen dass es schon zu Ende ist. Dank der grandiosen Grafik und der nonstop-Action die sich einem bietet kommt keine Sekunde Langeweile auf. Das Flair ist genial und die Spieldynamik sehr eingängig für mich :)

After a little scratch in Bioshock 2, here we are with a superb new chapter in a totally new (maybe opposite, if you mind) universe: the Sky!

New mechanics that brings you cool and fresh action, incredible perfection in graphics, and most of all, an active and smart "companion" (Elizabeth) that really helps you in the whole adventure!

WATCH OUT - You may fall in love with her! ;)

I dont understand how this iteration of Bioshock got such good reviews, it was nowhere near as good as 1 & 2. I found it boring and immersion breaking. Lets say you clear an area, the game magically spawns in new enemy right behind you. Happens time and time again. Its like the devs ran out of will power. Bioshock Infinite is an incredible game. With a gorgeously aesthetic world, the believable characters, and the intense up-close-and-personal action this game will draw you in until you have played several hours longer than you had planned! The story is gripping and makes you continue to want more, to explore the environments and the beautiful and eerie setting that you play through. The situations are intense and really play up to the Bioshock reputation. I can't wait to play the DLCs!
Beautiful. Engrossing. Provocative. Addictive. This game lingers with you long after you've played it.

Amazing game!!!!! excellent in every aspect, but I prefere the history and the visuals. The city of Columbia is the perfect scenario, every aspect of its design seem to be carefully planned, and the art is everywhere. Rapture is scary and dark, but Columbia is plenty of color and life. Elizabeth is the center of the history, and her development (since a innocent girl to an old lady capable to make horrible things, and back) gives this game a unique narrative. In my opinion, a must-have for every gamer.
Get this game! It's worth whatever price it is!

The issue is that the difficulty comes from enemies becoming damage sponges, and you simply not ebing able to carry the ammuntion you need to take down the larger threats. Set it on normal, sit back and enjoy the story. If you were looking for knockout gameplay, this is not the game for you.
Excellent game. Great action, compellingly mind-blowing story. Get this game.
dont buy it
10/10 game. But I paid $20 for this yesterday and it's $10 today, horsecrap!

Bioshock Infinate is the most beautiful game that I've ever played. It's as epic and revolutionary as the first. Improving the aleady almost perfect Bioshock seemed impossible but Rapture has spread its wings and taken off to the heights of Columbia. This is one of the few games I've replayed (1999 mode). 10/10

As you can expect from bioshock, there's a loooot of mindplay here. 
First though, in a sense it seems almost distant from the original - instead of suspense, it's much higher action, and the atmosphere is quite different and almost peaceful at times when you have someone with you all the time...and everyone isn't a complete spliced up psycho. Also, the game's plot has less depth on the surface compared to that of the social class, idealogy, and your choices in Rapture, as it feels like you could sum Infinite at first up with "RACISTS IN THE SKY."

Still, with minor things to note like cleaned up mechanics, some sightseeing feel to it, and an actual speaking character, it does feel fresh.

Overall, I'd say this game is pretty amazing. Definitely worth the purchase. Compare it as much as you want to the original, it's definitely its own game.

The hype of this game left many of the gameplay and animation issues unmentioned by critics.  It's an immerssive world, with beautiful art direction. The game play has a lot of potential, but it lacks enough polish to make this a truely amazing game. I'd say it's definitely worth playing, but lower your expectations and you will have a better time.
Mind-blowing.

Probably the best game I have played in a while. The graphics look amazing despite my mediocre graphics card. The story and narrative are great and the environment is alive with interaction. Having Elizabeth by your side is a lovely experience and I am looking forward to playing more of this game.

Bioshock is what I hope HL:Episode 3 would be like, except it has magic. Well, it doesn't call it magic, but it's the same idea. You're a private investigator who can't investigate for dick and gets pulled along by the undertow of fate and personalities in the universe. And that's just fine. You can switch between two kinetic weapons out of quite a few in the game ranging from pistols to RPGs. Some are better than others, and at one point the overvariety of similar weapons gets a bit overbearing. You also have the power of 'vigors' (spells). I find these similar to the weapons in that there are some stand-outs that I love using but many fall into the "me-too" category, particularly those that are only obtained late in the game. The very first vigor, possession, is by far the most useful and fun in general combat situations. There is also a grusome (if fun) melee attack that tends to become obsolete early due to the prevelence of guns unless you find the right gear to improve it when more difficult enemies appear.

The most similar aspect to the HL2 series is your companion, Elizabeth, who assists you for much of the game. Unlike Alyx in the aformentioned series, Elizabeth doesn't engage in (and outshine you at) combat. Instead she will throw items to the player and effectively act as an engineer by pulling turrents and other defensive items out of her tear. Oh, tears... those are "rips in dimensional time and space, revealing an alternate universe, which does not exist in the current world." Don't worry, it makes sense in context. While Elizabeth's role could be otherwise filled, she is useful in combat and does not require guarding, a good choice by the devs. 

She's a compelling character that is the real star of the story, not the player controlled 'Booker." And the story is quite good, though it's confusing at times and feels like it has a few aborted endings. Most of the time it's compelling, though, and makes you want to keep playing to find out what's going on through the time loops and dimensional warps that occur. The ending is a powerful gut punch, and not wishy-washy at all. There are some choices in the game, but none matter. Or perhaps they all matter, but none can alter the ending- further explanation would be spoilerish and get into the philosophy of determinism. There are plot holes, as with any story that involves some sort of time/space warp, but it's a good story with a puncuated ending that I needed to sit back and recover from afterwards.  Then I quickly restarted so I could get back to the more carefree portions of the game and also start to see the events from the hindsight of knowing how everything plays out. There's a lot of backstory lying unobtrusively around for those who want to look for it in a playthrough.

Cons include an awful save system (this is 2015, why can't we figure this out?) and a couple of portions of the game that are too repetitive with no payoff.

I'd say the game is a steal at sale prices under $30.

I didn't play the first bioshock but I think it might be a good time to pick it up...

"Perfection is not the absence of faults.  It's being able to look past them."  Truer words were never spoken in regards to this game.  There are some niggling details that hold this game back from perfection.  Most notably, almost all the gear sucks and is ridiculously underpowered.  There are only 3 or 4 really good pieces, out of set of more than 20.  However, the controls are very responsive, and clearly feel that it was built from the ground up for PC, unlike some other abominations I could name.  (I'm looking at you, Dark Souls).  The graphics, sound, and music are all astonishing, and serve to truly immerse you in the experience.  The game is also VERY well optimized.  I have a 3 year old PC, and I can run on highest settings with very short loading screens and virtually no lag.  Booker and Elizabeth are probably the greatest tag team ever seen.  Elizabeth is a rarity for companions because she is so goddamn useful.  Almost dead?  She tosses you a health pack.  Running out of ammo?  No problem, here you go.  Full stop, best goddamn FPS of the 21st Century.  1999 mode will make you sweat and get your heart rate pounding.  The heavyweight contender for GOTY.

This game is worth buying and playing. In short it is worth it for the story alone

Pros
+Amazing story
+Visually stunning
+Some replayability

Cons
=Combat is not fun
-2 Gun carrying limit
-Some elements feel shoehorned in from Bioshock 1&2
